comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: What a handsome old station, happily not much altered today apart from an extension to the left side in exactly the same style which must have happened soon after this photo. I bet there is a convenient date on the gable of the extension, if anyone is near Bathurst. The station was opened on April 4, 1876 by the then Governor of New South Wales, Sir Hercules Robinson (it was a Tuesday). I wonder if this photo has something to do with the opening? Google street view - maps.google.com.au/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&... Wikipedia article - en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bathurst_railway_station,_New_South...

comment.author: 22616984@N07
comment._content: "The opening of the Great Western Railway from the Metropolis to Bathurst, by the extension from Kelso to that place, was inaugurated here to day (April 4) in a most successful way, and with much ceremony." The Maitland Mercury & Hunter River General Advertiser (NSW : 1843-1893) Thursday 6 April 1876

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Thank you both for this information. Sounds like a great day for a celebration  "The weather was most enjoyable, and the day was observed as a general holiday in town..." (from above link)
